intro: Cineraria bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive blue and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its foliage is grayish-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring. Cineraria bicolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
